page.title: 06THE CLIFFE FAMILY.
page.content: The Cliffe family lived in Mathon and owned a pub named after them.It was most probably built about 400 years ago.After a while,about 7 years ago,its name was changed to Trundle Inn,but unfortunately nobody went there and so they changed it back to its old name The Cliffe Arms,now it is always full again. The family originally owned Mathon village,the village was in the original Domesday Book. The Cliffe family lived in Mathon from about 1070.When they died they were put in Mathon church.Elizabeth Cliffe was burried under the floor and wished{never to be lifted by human {hands.}
